3.text: Munidasa Cumaratunga Munidasa Cumaratunga was born on 25th July 1887. He was a writer, poet, journalist and grammarian. He wrote many Sinhala story books. Heenseraya, Hathpana, Magulkema and Kiyawana Nuwana are some of them. These books are popular among children even today.
3.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'><phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='munidasa'>Munidasa</phoneme> <break time='200ms'/> <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='kumaratuŋga'>Cumaratunga</phoneme> <break time='200ms'/> <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='munidasa'>Munidasa</phoneme> <break time='200ms'/> <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='kumaratuŋga'>Cumaratunga</phoneme> <break time='200ms'/> was <break time='200ms'/> born <break time='200ms'/> on <break time='200ms'/> 25th <break time='200ms'/> July <break time='200ms'/> 1887. <break time='200ms'/> He <break time='200ms'/> was <break time='200ms'/> a <break time='200ms'/> writer, <break time='200ms'/> poet, <break time='200ms'/> journalist <break time='200ms'/> and <break time='200ms'/> grammarian. <break time='200ms'/> He <break time='200ms'/> wrote <break time='200ms'/> many <break time='200ms'/> Sinhala <break time='200ms'/> story <break time='200ms'/> books. <break time='200ms'/> Heenseraya, <break time='200ms'/> Hathpana, <break time='200ms'/> Magulkema <break time='200ms'/> and <break time='200ms'/> Kiyawana <break time='200ms'/> Nuwana <break time='200ms'/> are <break time='200ms'/> some <break time='200ms'/> of <break time='200ms'/> them. <break time='200ms'/> These <break time='200ms'/> books <break time='200ms'/> are <break time='200ms'/> popular <break time='200ms'/> among <break time='200ms'/> children <break time='200ms'/> even <break time='200ms'/> today. <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

4.text: Munidasa Cumaratunga founded the "Hela Havula" movement to promote the correct usage of the Sinhala language. He wrote Sinhala grammar books and had a wide knowledge of other languages like Tamil, Pali, Sanskrit, Greek and Latin. In his lifetime, he served as a school teacher, principal and school inspector. This eminent scholar passed away on 2nd March 1944.
